description:
A sound regulatory strategy is needed to bring a medical
device to market as well as to safeguard public health.
Regulatory strategy needs to address three areas,
including product and design development, product
manufacture and market vigilance. Regulatory
professionals and in particular those in lead roles will need
to be strategic and “innovative.” Implementing a strategy
requires examination of the potential pitfalls and planning
to mitigate any risks, challenges or issues a drug might
face. This module will equip the participants with skills to
formulate, implement and execute a strategy for bringing a
medical device to market.
title: Strategic Planning for Medical Devices
